item.title: By: Alexandre Popoff
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Popoff
item.description: Thanks for your comment ! Indeed, I now see that there is a typo in the paper which completely escaped me during the review process, and I'm sorry for that. Obviously, it should be n_m L (n+8)_M as is the case for all generalizations of L, since we want them to coincide with the usual neo-Riemannian operator on major/minor triads.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for your comment ! Indeed, I now see that there is a typo in the paper which completely escaped me during the review process, and I’m sorry for that. Obviously, it should be n_m L (n+8)_M as is the case for all generalizations of L, since we want them to coincide with the usual neo-Riemannian operator on major/minor triads.

item.title: By: lievenlb
item.dc:creator: lievenlb
item.description: Thanks Alexandre! I based myself on your definition 5.2 in 'On the use of relational...' where L is not symmetric for major and minor triads. With the L you suggest I do indeed get as the sizes of the two monoids 473293 and 994624. I'll make corrections to the blogpost.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Alexandre! I based myself on your definition 5.2 in ‘On the use of relational…’ where L is not symmetric for major and minor triads. With the L you suggest I do indeed get as the sizes of the two monoids 473293 and 994624.
I’ll make corrections to the blogpost.

item.title: By: Alexandre Popoff
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Popoff
item.description: I meant 473293 (and not 473283) in my comment above....
item.content:encoded: I meant 473293 (and not 473283) in my comment above….

item.title: By: lievenlb
item.dc:creator: lievenlb
item.description: GAP seems to need a lot more time calculating sizes when using BinaryRelationOnPoints. But yes, I do get the same numbers.
item.content:encoded: GAP seems to need a lot more time calculating sizes when using BinaryRelationOnPoints. But yes, I do get the same numbers.

item.title: By: Alexandre Popoff
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Popoff
item.description: The difference in monoid sizes is strange. Have you tried with BinaryRelationOnPoints in GAP instead of PBRs (which seem a little bit complicated) ?
item.content:encoded: The difference in monoid sizes is strange. Have you tried with BinaryRelationOnPoints in GAP instead of PBRs (which seem a little bit complicated) ?
